meanings.definition: A personal name given to an individual in ancient Rome, typically used as a first name.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, each person had a praenomen that distinguished them from others.
meanings.sent2: My praenomen is Marcus, which was a common name in Roman society.
meanings.sent3: I wonder what would happen if someone had a praenomen that was also a number, like 'Seven'!
meanings.sent4: Her praenomen shone brightly among the sea of ordinary names, like a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The praenomen 'Julius' echoes through history, carrying tales of power and influence.

meanings.definition: The first of the three names in the Roman naming convention, coming before the nomen and cognomen.
meanings.sent1: Before the nomen and cognomen, the praenomen was given to a person in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: His praenomen, Gaius, indicated his family's standing in Roman society.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if someone's praenomen was so long that it took up an entire scroll!
meanings.sent4: The praenomen acted as a herald, announcing the arrival of a distinguished individual.
meanings.sent5: Like a flag raised high, the praenomen fluttered proudly at the forefront of his identity.
